synopsis: In episode #11 titled 'SOLOOOO', Ahir shares his recent experiences after dislocating his kneecap while playing soccer, reflecting on the challenges he faced navigating the healthcare system and the personal growth that came from this unexpected journey. He also dives into deeper themes of loneliness, love, and emotional intelligence, offering listeners a candid and relatable exploration of life's complexities while maintaining a light-hearted tone throughout.
quotes: The way you live your life every day is how you end up living your life.
You can have parents who love you very much, but when you feel lonely, like nobody understands you, it’s just different.
Are you able to feel joy by yourself? Do you have fun in your own company?
Open your arms if you want to be held.
Cooking isn’t that hard; ingredients are just Legos. You just need to figure out what types of things go together.
It's hard to let go of the idea that a relationship is going to last until your last breath.
The ability to love and be loved does exist, but you may not be able to feel it for a bit.
Sometimes, you just have to let it hurt you. You can't rationalize why someone hurt you.
I feel like the biggest change we need is teaching emotional intelligence in schools.
Love is a choice, but you have to pick loving yourself over loving someone else for the big life things.
